title: uninstall is not usable to uninstall correctly super-datasets (with or without sub-datasets installed)

milestone.title: Release 0.4.2
milestone.description: was never released -- will be absorbed into 0.5

body:
1. uninstall --recursive first uninstalls (and saves that changes) submodules and then fails to remove "itself"
```shell
$> cd /tmp/datasets.datalad.org 
crcns/  dicoms/  indi/  kaggle/  labs/  neurovault/  nidm/  openfmri/
(venv-tests) 2 16837 [1].....................................:Tue 01 Nov 2016 04:30:39 PM EDT:.
(git)hopa:/tmp/datasets.datalad.org[master]git
$> datalad install crcns
[INFO   ] Installing subdataset <Dataset path=/tmp/datasets.datalad.org/crcns> 
1 installed item is available at
<Dataset path=/tmp/datasets.datalad.org/crcns>
(venv-tests) 2 16838 [1].....................................:Tue 01 Nov 2016 04:30:43 PM EDT:.
(git)hopa:/tmp/datasets.datalad.org[master]git
$> datalad uninstall --remove-history --remove-handles crcns
[ERROR  ] will not uninstall content in subdatasets without the recursive flag [uninstall.py:__call__:229] (ValueError) 
(venv-tests) 2 16839 ->1 [1].....................................:Tue 01 Nov 2016 04:30:53 PM EDT:.
(git)hopa:/tmp/datasets.datalad.org[master]git
$> datalad uninstall --remove-history --remove-handles --recursive crcns
[WARNING] cannot uninstall data only, not an annex dataset 
[ERROR  ] Cannot delete module at /tmp/datasets.datalad.org/crcns as there are new commits [base.py:remove:843] (InvalidGitRepositoryError) 

(git)hopa:/tmp/datasets.datalad.org[master]git
$> cd crcns 
aa-1/   alm-2/  cai-2/            fcx-1/  hc-5/    mt-1/   pfc-3/   pvc-3/  pvc-8/  ssc-2/  vim-2/
aa-2/   am-1/   ch-epfl-2009/     hc-1/   hc-6/    ofc-1/  pfc-4/   pvc-4/  pvc-9/  ssc-3/  vim-3/
ac-1/   am-2/   datapackage.json  hc-2/   ia-1/    ofc-2/  pvc-1/   pvc-5/  ret-1/  th-1/   zipser-1/
ac-2/   bst-1/  dream/            hc-3/   infe-1/  pfc-1/  pvc-10/  pvc-6/  sim-1/  v2-1/
alm-1/  cai-1/  eye-1/            hc-4/   lgn-1/   pfc-2/  pvc-2/   pvc-7/  ssc-1/  vim-1/
(venv-tests) 2 16845 [1].....................................:Tue 01 Nov 2016 04:32:41 PM EDT:.
(git)hopa:/tmp/datasets.datalad.org/crcns[master]git
$> git show
commit cb9815eec41343c018cdc9f4ba1b0329e0fcb272
Author: Yaroslav Halchenko <debian@onerussian.com>
Date:   Tue Nov 1 16:30:57 2016 -0400

    Removed at least one of child-modules of 'crcns'

diff --git a/.gitmodules b/.gitmodules
index db3486a..e69de29 100644
--- a/.gitmodules
+++ b/.gitmodules
@@ -1,158 +0,0 @@
-[submodule "pvc-1"]
-   path = pvc-1
-   url = ./pvc-1
```

so there is no "correct way" to uninstall super-datasets?

2. anyways, I think we agreed that "recursive" refers to recursion through sub-datasets, so it must not be demanded if there is no installed subdatasets, but it is:
```shell
hopa:/tmp
$> datalad install ///  
[INFO   ] Installing dataset at /tmp/datasets.datalad.org from http://datasets.datalad.org/ 
1 installed item is available at
<Dataset path=/tmp/datasets.datalad.org>
(venv-tests) 2 16849 [1].....................................:Tue 01 Nov 2016 04:33:32 PM EDT:.
hopa:/tmp
$> cd -
/tmp/datasets.datalad.org
crcns/  dicoms/  indi/  kaggle/  labs/  neurovault/  nidm/  openfmri/
(venv-tests) 2 16850 [1].....................................:Tue 01 Nov 2016 04:33:35 PM EDT:.
(git)hopa:/tmp/datasets.datalad.org[master]
$> datalad uninstall --remove-history --remove-handles crcns            
[ERROR  ] will not uninstall content in subdatasets without the recursive flag [uninstall.py:__call__:229] (ValueError) 
```
